definition: down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: Squat with your feet a little less than shoulder distance apart.
We must think, " replied Sado, squatting down in front of him."
sentences.chinese: “我们一定要相信，”回答的船舱，在他面前蹲下。

sentences.english: Pat Craig squats down and stares at the tiger.
sentences.chinese: 八克雷格蹲下，并在盯着老虎。

sentences.english: Gallagher bent low, eye-level with King.
sentences.chinese: 加拉赫蹲下身子，看着国王的眼睛。

sentences.english: For this exercise you need to get into a squat.
sentences.chinese: 在这次练习中你需要蹲下来。

sentences.english: Talk squatting down by children, communication hugging them, education holding their hands.
sentences.chinese: 蹲下来讲话，抱起来交流，牵着手教育。

sentences.english: Kate asks, and suddenly squats down and peers into Ruthie's face.
sentences.chinese: 凯特问，她忽然蹲下去，看着露丝的脸。

sentences.english: When we reach the footbridge over the canal, keep down or you'll bang your head on it!
sentences.chinese: 船行到运河上的人行桥时，要蹲下身子，不然会。

sentences.english: Thesoldiers and the police crouched in irrigation ditches and behind walls.
sentences.chinese: 士兵们和警察们蹲下来清洗沟渠和围墙。

sentences.english: He crouched down among the tangled foliage.
sentences.chinese: 蹲下把身子藏在紊乱的叶丛中。

sentences.english: Squat down to touch his own shadow, sorry to let you wronged.
sentences.chinese: 蹲下来抚摸自己的影子，对不起让你受委屈了。

sentences.english: He squatted down to peep into the basket.
sentences.chinese: 他蹲下来向篮子里窥视了一下。

sentences.english: Bink squatted to inspect the cut.
Then suddenly he squatted down beside Arthur .
sentences.chinese: 然后他突然在阿瑟旁边蹲下来。

sentences.english: She crouched down beside the heating vent to listen.
sentences.chinese: 她慢慢蹲下来，靠着热水汀来细细聆听。

sentences.english: Your instinct is to hunker down and figure out which is the "right" answer.
sentences.chinese: 你的直觉是蹲下来，捉摸一下哪个是‘对’的答案。

definition: to lean over/to bend over/to stoop/to bow
to land/to touch the ground/also pr. [zhuo2 di4]
(gymnastics) to do a bridge/to do a crab
to get up on hind legs (esp. of horse)/to stand/to spring up
to lie down/to drop to the ground
to bow/to bend at the waist
